Package net.threescale.api

This API is used to encapsulate the communication with the 3scale backend server for validating and reporting transactions between the user and the provider of a service.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Api Public interface for the 3scale API.
HttpConnectionFactory  
HttpSender Interface used to send Http Requests to the server.
 

Class Summary
ApiAuthorizeResponse Response returned by server to authorize message.
ApiBatchMetric Used to report a metric to the server @see Api.batch
ApiError DTO for error responses
ApiFactory Factory class to create 3scale Api objects.
ApiHttpResponse Reponse returned for Http Request.
ApiImpl Concrete implementation of the Api.
ApiStartResponse Contains the transaction information returned from a successful start operation.
ApiTransaction Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
ApiUsageMetric DTO for API Usage Metrics
ApiUtil  
HttpSenderImpl Sends requests to a server using Http.
LogFactory  
XmlHelper Common methods used on XML.
 

Exception Summary
ApiException Contains the reason information returned when an Api call fails.
 

Package net.threescale.api Description

This API is used to encapsulate the communication with the 3scale backend server for validating and reporting transactions between the user and the provider of a service. For the definitive specification of the interface refer to The 3scale Management API specification

Using the API

  • You instansiate an API object using a factory. This can be done once in your application, or in each transaction.
  • Send a 'start' to the server containing key supplied by the user.
  • Perform the transaction.
  • Send a 'confirm' for the transaction detailing what resources were used.

If you decide to abort the transaction you send a 'cancel' instead of a 'confirm'.

Example code

                Api api = ApiFactory.createApi("http://www.3scale.net", "My Provider Key");
                
                
                try {
                        ApiStartResponse transaction = api.start("Users Contract Key from your http request");

                        try {
                                // Perform your transaction
                                
                                Map metrics = new HashMap();
                                
                                // Set metrics used by the transaction. You define these in your contract.
                                metrics.put("requests", "1");
                                metrics.put("bytestransfered", "51983");
                                
                                try {
                                        api.confirm(transaction.getTransactionId(), metrics);
                                } catch (ApiException ex){
                                        // Log application error
                                        ex.printStackTrace();
                                }
                        }
                        catch (Exception ex) {
                                // Handle exception from application
                                try {
                                        api.cancel(transaction.getTransactionId());
                                } catch (ApiException ex2){
                                        // Log application error
                                        ex2.printStackTrace();
                                }
                        }
                        
                } catch (ApiException e) {
                        if (e.getResponseCode() == 403) {
                                // Analyse error and return error message to user
                        }
                }
        }

Jar file

The runtime Api is in the distribution tarball in dist/threescale-api.jar.
